title: Covid: Who is not vaccinated in the US and what's the risk?
description: We break down the facts on who's getting the shot and who's not - and each group's odds of survival.

title: Quiz of the Year, part three: Do you recall a busy summer of sport?
description: How well do you remember the news of the past 12 months?

title: LadBaby, Ed Sheeran and Elton John's Christmas hit
description: LadBaby are going for a record fourth UK Christmas number one in a row - with help from Ed and Elton.

title: Covid: Self-isolation cut from 10 days to seven with negative tests
description: The new rules in England mean some people could end their self-isolation in time for Christmas.

title: Covid in Wales: Groups of six allowed to meet in pubs
description: Premises will have to offer table service, face masks are to be worn and contact details collected.

title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang star Sally Ann Howes dies aged 91
description: The actress also appeared on Broadway in My Fair Lady and won a Tony Award for her part in Brigadoon.

title: New Covid-19 rules: 'I'm not isolating at Christmas now'
description: An early Christmas present to some in England who now won't need to isolate with Covid-19.

title: Louise Minchin: Stalker Carl Davies jailed more than two years
description: Carl Davies admitted sending intimidating comments to presenter Louise Minchin and her daughter Mia.

title: Nobody takes player welfare seriously - Henderson
description: Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson says he is "concerned" that "nobody really takes player welfare seriously".

title: Benjamin Mendy: Man City footballer charged with another rape
description: Footballer Benjamin Mendy is now facing seven counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

title: CrossCountry: Strike action set to disrupt Christmas Eve trains
description: A union says members voted to strike as they felt the role of guards was being undermined.

title: Met refers itself to watchdog over No 10 Christmas party
description: There is a "case to answer" over an alleged Covid rule-busting gathering, says Green Party peer.

title: England given 'kick up the bum' with 'brutally honest chat' - Wood
description: England's players had a "brutally honest chat" with coach Chris Silverwood after defeat by Australia in the second Ashes Test, says seamer Mark Wood.

title: Celebrity MasterChef: Channel 5 News apologises for revealing winner
description: The broadcaster announced the winner's name early during one of its news bulletins.

title: Australian Open organisers still unsure if defending champion Djokovic will play
description: Australian Open organisers are still unsure if defending men's champion Novak Djokovic will play at next month's Grand Slam.

title: Winter Olympics: Beijing 2022 will have lowest-ever gender gap
description: Winter Olympics will have the lowest-ever gender gap at Beijing 2022, data experts say.

title: Labuschagne replaces Root at the top of Test batting rankings
description: Australian Marnus Labuschagne replaces Joe Root at the top of the International Cricket Council's men's Test batting rankings.

title: Wightlink ferry crewman takes passenger 270 miles to party
description: Mark Mitchell makes a 500-mile round trip to get Hilary Spinks to her "Turkey and Tinsel" holiday.

title: Covid-19: Northern Ireland ministers to discuss restrictions
description: Ministers are meeting on Wednesday afternoon as Omicron cases rise in Northern Ireland.

title: Covid Omicron: European nations reinstate restrictions
description: As the Omicron variant spreads across the continent, countries tighten curbs to brace for another wave.

title: Super Typhoon Rai: BBC correspondent shows damage on Siargao Island
description: Take a look at the damage on Siargao Island after a powerful storm kills hundreds in the Philippines.

title: The Papers: Christmas can go ahead and test to see family
description: The news no fresh Covid curbs will be brought in before Christmas makes most of Wednesday's front pages.

title: Afghanistan: From a UK wedding to the streets of Kabul, in 24 hours
description: Lucy, 24, is one of 750 British soldiers who helped evacuate people from Afghanistan this summer.

title: Gaming disorder: Inside the clinic helping addicted teens
description: BBC News has exclusive access to the UK's only facility for video game addiction.

title: Maureen Lipman: Cancel culture could wipe out comedy
description: The actress says comedians fear being cancelled as a poll finds Britons often censor their opinions.

title: In pictures: Seven days of isolation
description: Photographer Richard Tymon captures seven days of isolation with his family in a hotel room in Sweden.

title: The Maasai TikTokers wowing Bollywood fans
description: Tanzanian siblings Kili and Neema Paul lip sync perfectly in Hindi, accruing millions of followers.

title: Carol in sign language spreads festive cheer
description: A school for deaf and visually impaired children has recorded a special Christmas carol video.
